oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Photomontage of a Vanderbilt alumni convention and athletic coach, a newspaper vendor, a boy with a model ship, a reverend, a picnic, a fraternity, an attorney, and a train wreck. Nashville Banner, 1926 December 26.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Leftwich, Shorty; Ford, Howard; Ingram, Arthur Foley Winnington; Jens, Arthur; Estes, P. M.; Dieffenbach, Albert C.; McAdams, Thomas; Wagner, Paul C.; Baer, Robert; Lippencott, W. H.; Darrow, Clarence; McGugin, Dan; Kirkland, James H.
Nashville Banner
Meetings; Coaches (Athletics); Men; Boys; Ships; Clergy; Fraternal organizations; Lawyers; Accidents; Railroads; Picnics
Nashville (Tenn.)--History--Sources; Nashville (Tenn.)--Social life and customs; Nashville and Davidson County (Tenn.)--History--Sources
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Photomontage of a Vanderbilt alumni convention and athletic coach, a newspaper vendor, a Clemons school student with a model ship, a visiting religious leader, a Grocers picnic at Wooddale, a Phi Kappa Sigma convention, an attorney from the famed Scopes trial, and a Hendersonville train wreck. 16 x 21.5 in. Forms part of the Nashville Newspaper Rotogravure Digital Images Collection.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Barr, W. E.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:publisher: Metropolitan Nashville/Davidson County Archives, Nashville Public Library
